content:
• Thursday, July 28, 2011
  • VZ

    Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) declares a $10B special distribution. Verizon shareholders - a 55%...

    Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) declares a $10B special distribution. Verizon shareholders - a 55% owner in the joint partnership - will receive $5.5B to be paid on January 31, 2012. Vodafone will receive $4.5B, and has declared a £2B special dividend payable to its shareholders as well. VZ +0.8%, VOD +5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 11 Comments
  • STEC

    More on the STEC miss: Shares -34% as the company lowers guidance for Q3, expecting revenue of...

    More on the STEC miss: Shares -34% as the company lowers guidance for Q3, expecting revenue of $70-72M and EPS of $0.08-0.10 vs. expectations of $96M and $0.31. CEO Moshayedi talks about an increasingly difficult competitive situation.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • STEC

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC): Q2 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $82.5M misses by $0.08M. Shares...

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC): Q2 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $82.5M misses by $0.08M. Shares -35% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • MCK

    McKesson (NYSE:MCK): EPS of $1.27 beats by $0.13. Revenues of $29.98B (+9 Y/Y) beats by $940M....

    McKesson (NYSE:MCK): EPS of $1.27 beats by $0.13. Revenues of $29.98B (+9 Y/Y) beats by $940M. Raises FY12 forecast EPS to a range of $6.09 to $6.29 per share. Stock +3.89% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • GOOG

    More from Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI) earnings: Expects Q3 EPS of $0.00-0.10 vs. consensus of...

    More from Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI) earnings: Expects Q3 EPS of $0.00-0.10 vs. consensus of $0.24 and full-year EPS of $0.48-0.60 vs. $0.71. Shipped 11M mobile devices including 4.4M smartphones and 440K tablets. Mobile devices revenues of $2.4B (up 41%); Home revenues of $907M (up 2%). Shares now -6.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • OSK

    More on Oshksoh (OSK -13%): stock hits a 2-year low after its F3Q earnings report this morning...

    More on Oshksoh (OSK -13%): stock hits a 2-year low after its F3Q earnings report this morning showed lower-than-expected margins in its key defense business. S&P Research cut the stock to hold, citing additional concerns over recovery prospects in its commercial markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • INGR

    Corn Products International (CPO -8.6%) gets sheared after Q2 profits fall short of forecasts,...

    Corn Products International (CPO -8.6%) gets sheared after Q2 profits fall short of forecasts, as rising corn prices gnaw at margin growth. The maker of sweeteners and corn starch lowers guidance for Q3, saying H2 will continue to be affected by rising costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • NTDOY

    Add Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY -12.3%) to Apple’s (AAPL +0.1%) list of conquests, as...

    Add Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY -12.3%) to Apple’s (AAPL +0.1%) list of conquests, as Nintendo’s steep price cut on its four-month old 3DS handheld game console is a sign that "smartphones like the iPhone are taking over gaming," Michael Comeau writes. Various advances now ensure a fun smartphone gaming experience, not the case in 2004 when DS first hit the market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • OSTK

    Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) isn't sharing in eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) and Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q2...

    Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) isn't sharing in eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) and Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q2 success: shares are down 9.7% after the company reported Q2 revenue and EPS of $235M (up just 2% Y/Y) and -$0.34, below a consensus of $242.1M and -$0.17. Free cash flow for the quarter was -$16.7M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • GNC

    Health store chain GNC is up 13.6% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $518.5M (+14%...

    Health store chain GNC is up 13.6% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $518.5M (+14% Y/Y) and $0.39, above a consensus of $490M and $0.32. Same-store sales in domestic company-owned stores rose 10.7% Y/Y. GNC expects 2011 revenue and adjusted EPS of $1.98B-$2B and $1.28-$1.30, above a consensus of $1.96B and $1.21.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • ECYT

    Endocyte (ECYT +8%) jumps after pricing a secondary offering of 5.8M shares at $12.26 each,...

    Endocyte (ECYT +8%) jumps after pricing a secondary offering of 5.8M shares at $12.26 each, in-line with yesterday's closing price. The company had initially filed to sell 4,9M shares, but an additional 900K was added at the last moment by an existing institutional shareholder once the placement showed outsized demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S -17.4%) and Clearwire (CLWR -24.5%) are both falling hard following Sprint's Q2...

    Sprint (S -17.4%) and Clearwire (CLWR -24.5%) are both falling hard following Sprint's Q2 results and LightSquared deal. Sprint's 101K net postpaid subscriber loss was worse than Bloomberg's consensus forecast of 25K, and, as Bernstein notes, the company's OIBDA margin declined Y/Y and fell short of analyst estimates. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 7 Comments
  • CACH

    Women's specialty apparel store Cache (OTC:CACH +15.7%) pops after handily beating Q2 EPS and...

    Women's specialty apparel store Cache (OTC:CACH +15.7%) pops after handily beating Q2 EPS and revenue expectations. The company says its bottom-line was helped by improved operating margins, and top-line sales jumped three-fold Y/Y due to a favorable mix of design merchandise.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Rare-earth miner Molycorp (MCP +8.7%) gains after saying earlier that it's modified one of its...

    Rare-earth miner Molycorp (MCP +8.7%) gains after saying earlier that it's modified one of its major supply contracts, allowing the company to boost prices for the lanthanum it produces through 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • GT

    Goodyear (GT -7.2%) shares opened higher after a big earnings beat, but reversed course after...

    Goodyear (GT -7.2%) shares opened higher after a big earnings beat, but reversed course after the company warned that raw material costs rising at a 30%-plus clip would make it tough to maintain profit margins in its North American tire business in the second half of the year. Goodyear also estimates the number of tires sold this year at the lower end of its forecast range.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • QTM-OLD

    Storage system vendor Quantum (QTM-OLD -17.6%) is plunging after reporting FQ1 revenue and...

    Storage system vendor Quantum (QTM-OLD -17.6%) is plunging after reporting FQ1 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $154M (-6% Y/Y) and $0.01, below a consensus of $159.9M and $0.03. The company expects FQ2 revenue of $160M, below a $170.3M consensus. Quantum blames its FQ1 shortfall on weak disk system and software sales (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • ARRS

    More on Arris Group (ARRS +11%): shares of the high-speed local network access provider trade...

    More on Arris Group (ARRS +11%): shares of the high-speed local network access provider trade higher after Q2 earnings topped estimates on improving gross margins and increased demand for its home media gateway products.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • STRA

    Strayer Education (STRA -14.7%) shares nosedive after posting a 17% decline in Q2 earnings on...

    Strayer Education (STRA -14.7%) shares nosedive after posting a 17% decline in Q2 earnings on big drops in total enrollments, new student enrollments and total online students. Meanwhile, Sen. Charles Grassley is examining whether Education Department officials disclosed secret information to hedge fund managers, including for-profit ed nemesis Steve Eisman.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (SBUX +4%), Peet's Coffee (PEET +2.7%), and Dunkin' Brands (DNKN +3.4%) are joining...

    Starbucks (SBUX +4%), Peet's Coffee (PEET +2.7%), and Dunkin' Brands (DNKN +3.4%) are joining Coffee Holding Co. (JVA +22.1%) in trading higher due to Green Mountain's (GMCR +19%) blowout Q3 and strong guidance. Four analysts are lifting their targets on Green Mountain to the $120-$125 range, as a short squeeze helps fuel today's rise. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • RNOW

    Customer relationship management software firm RightNow (NASDAQ:RNOW) is up 20.7% after...

    Customer relationship management software firm RightNow (NASDAQ:RNOW) is up 20.7% after announcing Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $54.8M (+26% Y/Y) and $0.15, beating a consensus of $54.1M and $0.12. The company expects 2011 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $226M and $0.58, compared with a consensus of $226.5M and $0.56. ((PDF)) (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • LLNW

    Limelight Networks (LLNW -5.5%) is getting hit hard by rival Akamai's (AKAM -18.5%)...

    Limelight Networks (LLNW -5.5%) is getting hit hard by rival Akamai's (AKAM -18.5%) disappointing Q2; and Electronics Arts (ERTS -0.6%) is underperforming the NASDAQ following weak numbers from THQ (THQI -21.6% ) and Nintendo (NTDOY.PK -10.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • IPG

    More on Interpublic Group (IPG -17%): Q2 revenues were higher as a jump in international...

    More on Interpublic Group (IPG -17%): Q2 revenues were higher as a jump in international business helped drive growth, but higher staff-related costs hit bottom-line margins greater than expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • AXTI

    Semiconductor supplier AXT (AXTI +20%) jumps on solid Q2 earnings and bullish Q3 guidance. The...

    Semiconductor supplier AXT (AXTI +20%) jumps on solid Q2 earnings and bullish Q3 guidance. The company says its top-line benefited from market-share gains and broader strength in its LED and fiber-optic spaces. Needham upgrades the stock to a buy, saying its "sales will continue to grow due to capacity expansion of its JVs and firm material prices."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • CHTR

    Time Warner Cable (TWC) drops 4.2% after releasing Q2 results. The market isn't pleased with the...

    Time Warner Cable (TWC) drops 4.2% after releasing Q2 results. The market isn't pleased with the loss of 130k residential video subscribers, below analyst estimates, as competition from AT&T (NYSE:T) and Verizon (NYSE:VZ) takes its toll. Comcast (CMCSA -1.2%), Cablevision (CVC -0.8%), and Charter (CHTR -1.9%) are moving lower in sympathy. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • SPRT

    Support.com (SPRT -18%) isn't finding any today, tanking after reporting better Q2 revenues late...

    Support.com (SPRT -18%) isn't finding any today, tanking after reporting better Q2 revenues late yesterday but missing on its bottom-line EPS number. The company says margins were reduced due to restructuring and impairment charges, acquisition expenses and the writing down of certain assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • BMC

    More on BMC Software (BMC -8%): FQ1 profits rose, but the stock trades off after the company...

    More on BMC Software (BMC -8%): FQ1 profits rose, but the stock trades off after the company lowers growth expectations. The software maker says bookings for the current quarter underway are coming in below expectations, due to a slowdow in Europe and weakness in its federal business unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • TDY

    Teledyne Technologies (NYSE:TDY) is up 8.3% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS from continuing...

    Teledyne Technologies (NYSE:TDY) is up 8.3% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS from continuing operations of $502.9M (+23% Y/Y) and $1.04, beating a consensus of $480M and $0.77. The company expects Q3 and 2011 EPS of $0.83-$0.87 and $3.57-$3.63, respectively, above consensus figures of $0.82 and $3.31.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • RCL

    Royal Caribbean (RCL -9.8%) Q2 profits grew as the company's overall capacity and yields...

    Royal Caribbean (RCL -9.8%) Q2 profits grew as the company's overall capacity and yields improved, but the stock is getting hit after lowering Q3 guidance. The company says its debt is more expensive to service than previously estimated, and turmoil in the Eastern Mediterranean region is having a greater than anticipated negative impact on bookings.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • BABY

    Natus Medical (NASDAQ:BABY), which had already preannounced a weak Q2, is down 12.2% after...

    Natus Medical (NASDAQ:BABY), which had already preannounced a weak Q2, is down 12.2% after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $58.1M (+10% Y/Y) and $0.13, compared with a consensus of $57.9M and $0.14. The company now expects 2011 revenue of $236M and non-GAAP EPS of $0.58-$0.60, below prior guidance of $250M and $0.80-$0.81.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • TUR

    Shares in Turkey are sharply higher as the lira - following a sharp drop last week - looks to...

    Shares in Turkey are sharply higher as the lira - following a sharp drop last week - looks to have stabilized without the central bank resorting to a hike in interest rates. TUR +4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • CHEF

    After going public today at an IPO price of $15, shares of specialty food distributor Chefs...

    After going public today at an IPO price of $15, shares of specialty food distributor Chefs Warehouse (NASDAQ:CHEF) are now up 15.1% to $17.26. The company, which saw March quarter sales increase 19% Y/Y, intends to use its IPO proceeds to redeem preferred stock and pay down debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • HRC

    Hill-Rom Holdings (HRC -17%) FQ3 profits plunge 95% as its bottom line is hit by lower margins...

    Hill-Rom Holdings (HRC -17%) FQ3 profits plunge 95% as its bottom line is hit by lower margins resulting from an unfavorable product mix, higher material costs and a $30M charge related to a potential legal settlement.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • CSCO

    Cisco (CSCO +3.8%) is “still solid,” Goldman Sachs says, raising its rating to Buy...

    Cisco (CSCO +3.8%) is “still solid,” Goldman Sachs says, raising its rating to Buy and its price target to $21, noting that structural issues are confined to its switching business which drives just one-third of sales. Goldman expects sales growth to rebound to “normalized” 5%-7% in 2012, while the mix shift in switching that has driven margins lower is "halfway complete."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • YNDX

    Russian search king Yandex (NASDAQ:YNDX) drops 6.5% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of...

    Russian search king Yandex (NASDAQ:YNDX) drops 6.5% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $161.7M and $0.12, compared with a consensus of $150.4M and $0.13. Excluding traffic acquisition costs, revenue was $138.9M. The company is guiding for 2011 ruble-based revenue growth of 55-60%, compared with a consensus for 57% dollar-based growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • WEN

    Wendy's (WEN +1.3%) is initiated at Janney as a Buy with a target price of $6.50 after...

    Wendy's (WEN +1.3%) is initiated at Janney as a Buy with a target price of $6.50 after yesterday's close, citing rising same-store sales and menu improvements. The firm expects Wendy’s to overtake Burger King for the no. 2 market-share position within the limited-service burger sector, perhaps as soon as this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • SBUX

    Shares of specialty tea retailer Teavana (TEA +61.2%) soar early on its first day of trading....

    Shares of specialty tea retailer Teavana (TEA +61.2%) soar early on its first day of trading. The IPO, priced at $17/share, raised $121M. The company, with nearly 200 stores in the U.S. and Mexico, earned $12M on sales of $125M last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • RGR

    Firearm manufacturer Sturn, Ruger & Co. (NYSE:RGR) is up 24.3% after reporting Q2 revenue...

    Firearm manufacturer Sturn, Ruger & Co. (NYSE:RGR) is up 24.3% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $79.6M (+24% Y/Y) and $0.57, easily beating a consensus of $69.8M and $0.41. The company is also declaring a quarterly dividend of 14.2 cents/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • RBYCF

    Rubicon Minerals (RBY +27%) soars after Agnico-Eagle (AEM -4.3%) makes a strategic investment of...

    Rubicon Minerals (RBY +27%) soars after Agnico-Eagle (AEM -4.3%) makes a strategic investment of C$70 million in the company through a 21M share private placement. The true value of this deal is that by surrendering just 9% of its ownership, Rubicon now gains access to Agnico Eagles extensive geological and engineering expertise.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • TBI

    Blue-collar staffing services firm TrueBlue (NYSE:TBI) soars 17.6% after reporting Q2 revenue...

    Blue-collar staffing services firm TrueBlue (NYSE:TBI) soars 17.6% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $320.2M (+12% Y/Y) and $0.20, compared with a consensus of $320M and $0.18. The company is guiding for Q3 revenue of $360M-$370M and EPS of $0.27-$0.32, compared with a consensus of $349.2M and $0.30.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • MVIS

    Display technology provider Microvision (NASDAQ:MVIS) is up 6.7% after announcing a deal with...

    Display technology provider Microvision (NASDAQ:MVIS) is up 6.7% after announcing a deal with Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) regarding the distribution of the company's SHOWVX miniature projectors for portable and mobile devices. Microvision shares moved higher last week after releasing Q2 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • KATE

    More on Liz Claiborne (LIZ +15.75%): Q2 loss widened on higher expenses, but EPS was in-line...

    More on Liz Claiborne (LIZ +15.75%): Q2 loss widened on higher expenses, but EPS was in-line with expectations. Sales topped estimates, and growth margins widened as the company's Kate Spade brand posted double-digit sales growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • EQIX

    Data center operator Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) is up 7.4% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of...

    Data center operator Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) is up 7.4% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $394.9M (+33% Y/Y) and $0.64, beating a consensus of $380.5M and $0.48. Operating cash flow rose 147% Y/Y to $140.3M. The company is guiding for Q3 and FY2011 revenue of $412M-$417M and $1.59B, above consensus figures of $395M and $1.55B. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • XOM

    Exxon Mobil (XOM -2.4%) missed its Q2 earnings target partly because of low natural gas prices,...

    Exxon Mobil (XOM -2.4%) missed its Q2 earnings target partly because of low natural gas prices, Oppenheimer analyst Fadel Gheit says. "They're producing too much gas." Downstream is blamed too, as refining earnings from outside the U.S. fell 20% Y/Y. Results aren't expected to improve for at least the rest of this year, amid signs the oil rally may be cooling.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • SKX

    Skechers (NYSE:SKX) is up 18.1% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $434M (-14% Y/Y)...

    Skechers (NYSE:SKX) is up 18.1% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $434M (-14% Y/Y) and -$0.31, compared with a consensus of $434.5M and -$0.31. The company states international sales grew by double digits, and claims to be pleased with the reception of new product offerings. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • IMAX

    IMAX is down 13.3%% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $57.2M (+3% Y/Y) and $0.07,...

    IMAX is down 13.3%% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $57.2M (+3% Y/Y) and $0.07, below a consensus of $62.8M and $0.20. The company blames the shortfalls on weak film performance and a high investment level. IMAX expects adjusted earnings to decline in 2011, and revenues to be "consistent with last year."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
  • BC

    Brunswick (NYSE:BC): Q2 EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $1.01B (+8% Y/Y) misses by $40M....

    Brunswick (NYSE:BC): Q2 EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $1.01B (+8% Y/Y) misses by $40M. Sees FY'11 EPS of $0.60-0.75. Shares +5.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA) jumps in premarket trading on the back Green Mountain Coffee's...

    Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA) jumps in premarket trading on the back Green Mountain Coffee's (NASDAQ:GMCR) solid FQ3 results. The company is one of Green Mountains suppliers, generating nearly 50% of its sales from the company. JVA +11.6%, GMCR +20% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI) shares sink premarket after reporting a revenue shortfall for FQ1, blaming...

    THQ (THQI) shares sink premarket after reporting a revenue shortfall for FQ1, blaming disappointing sales of “Red Faction: Armageddon” as well as its licensed children’s videogame titles, and lowering its outlook. THQ's net loss was $0.56/share vs. a net loss of $0.44/share for the year-ago period; revenue rose 31% to $195M. THQI -21.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • IRE

    It's Wilbur Ross, among others, who invested €1.1B into Bank of Ireland (NYSE:IRE) earlier...

    It's Wilbur Ross, among others, who invested €1.1B into Bank of Ireland (NYSE:IRE) earlier this week, a move that will keep the lender from falling completely into government hands. The new group will own 35% of the bank, with the government stake falling to 15%. Shares +15.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • DVAX

    Premarket gainers: DVAX +28%. GMCR +21%. MVIS +17%. IRE +16%. RBY +15%. LIZ +12%. JVA +12%. SKX...

    Premarket gainers: DVAX +28%. GMCR +21%. MVIS +17%. IRE +16%. RBY +15%. LIZ +12%. JVA +12%. SKX +12%. LSI-OLD +11%. CROX +8%. EQIX +7%. ECYT +6%. BSX +6%. GT +5%. CELG +4%. CAM +4%. ELNK +4%. MCP +4%. POT +3%. RAD +3%. WFM +2%. BCS +3%. BBVA +3%. SHPGY +3%. SNV +3%.
    Losers: GCVRZ -46%. SQNS -36%. TQNT -19%. ALU -14%. S -11%. LIFE -10%. IMAX -10%. OSK -8%. AIB -9%. RCL -7%. IPG -7%. MUR -7%. LOGI -7%. AIXG -6%. SFLY -5%. LRCX -5%. ASML -4%. CLF -4%. TS -4%. BPAX -3%. STM -3%. LINE -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GT

    More on Goodyear's (NYSE:GT) Q2: North American sales +18% Y/Y. EMEA +34%. Latin America +21%....

    More on Goodyear's (NYSE:GT) Q2: North American sales +18% Y/Y. EMEA +34%. Latin America +21%. Asia-Pac +27%. Expects 2011 unit growth at lower end of prior guidance range of 3-5%; sees macro weakness in developed markets and inflation in emerging markets. Also expects 2011 raw material costs up 30% Y/Y. GT +4.8% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • SQNS

    Sequans Communications (NYSE:SQNS) Q2 misses consensus across-the-board and lowers 2H guidance....

    Sequans Communications (NYSE:SQNS) Q2 misses consensus across-the-board and lowers 2H guidance. Q3 will be significantly below estimates, as CEO Georges Karam notes "more cautious ordering patterns" emerging, "which we believe are driven by some uncertainty related to several new WiMAX smartphone models being introduced." Shares -34% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • DVAX

    Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX) soars 24.3% premarket after saying the FDA "has confirmed our...

    Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX) soars 24.3% premarket after saying the FDA "has confirmed our assessment of lot consistency in the [Heplisav] Phase 3 trial we just announced." The company now plans to move forward with preparing a BLA for submission by the end of the year. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • XOM

    Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM): Q2 EPS of $2.18 misses by $0.15. Revenue of $125.5B. Shares -1.8%...

    Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM): Q2 EPS of $2.18 misses by $0.15. Revenue of $125.5B. Shares -1.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • MUR

    More on Murphy Oil (NYSE:MUR): Q2 earnings +14% as higher crude oil prices boosted upstream...

    More on Murphy Oil (NYSE:MUR): Q2 earnings +14% as higher crude oil prices boosted upstream revenue, but the company missed on the bottom-line EPS as downstream margins were impacted by higher input costs. The company lowers FY guidance. Shares -6.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +6.1% after posting a healthy earnings beat, and announcing a $1B...

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +6.1% after posting a healthy earnings beat, and announcing a $1B share repurchase program. The company also prepays the remaining $750M of its term loan borrowings, bringing gross debt down to $4.2B. Looking ahead, BoSci sees FY'11 EPS of $0.64-0.70 vs. prior guidance of $0.58-0.68.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • CAM

    Cameron International (NYSE:CAM): Q2 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.74B (+19.9% Y/Y)...

    Cameron International (NYSE:CAM): Q2 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.74B (+19.9% Y/Y) beats by $90M. Shares +2.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
